medical_history.chief_complaint: Continuous surveillance for potential malignancies due to Cowden syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of various medical issues starting at age 39, including bilateral breast masses, cerebellar tumor resection at age 40, and subsequent depression and incomplete hemiplegia at age 43. She was diagnosed with recurrent breast cancer with left-rib metastasis at age 46 and started hormonal therapy. By age 50, she was referred for continuous surveillance, including monitoring for uterine cancer and periodic endoscopies.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral invasive ductal carcinoma of the breast diagnosed at age 39, cerebellar tumors with hydrocephalus, multiple polyps in the stomach and large intestine, hamartomas identified at age 40, recurrent breast cancer diagnosed at age 46, and adenomatous goiter from thyroid mass resection.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's older sister clinically diagnosed with Cowden syndrome; father had macrocephaly, hydrocephalus, and oral mucosal papillomatosis, suggesting he likely also had Cowden syndrome.
medical_history.social_history: The patient resigned from her job to focus on treatment. Neither she nor her sister have children and both have reached menopause.
